001package edu.pdx.cs410J.examples;
002
003import java.io.*;
004import java.util.*;
005import javax.activation.*;
006import javax.mail.*;
007import javax.mail.internet.*;
008
009/**
010 * This program uses the JavaMail API to send a file to someone as a
011 * MIME attachment to an email.  More information about the JavaMail
012 * API is available from http://java.sun.com/products/javamail.
013 *
014 * @author David Whitlock
015 */
016public class MailFile {
017
018  private static PrintWriter err = new PrintWriter(System.err, true);
019
020  /**
021   * Prints out information about how to use this program.
022   */
023  private static void usage() {
024    err.println("usage: MailFile [options] file recipient [subject]");
025    err.println("  Where [options] are:");
026    err.println("  -server name   Name of the SMTP server");
027    err.println("  -verbose       Print out extra info");
028    System.exit(1);
029  }
030
031  /**
032   * Reads the name of the file to be sent, the recipient of the
033   * email, and the subject of the email (which may contain multiple
034   * words) from the command line.  Then uses the JavaMail API to
035   * construct an email message.
036   */
037  public static void main(String[] args) {
038    StringBuffer subject = null;
039    String fileName = null;
040    String recipient = null;
041    String serverName = "mailhost.pdx.edu";
042    boolean debug = false;
043
044    // Parse the command line
045    for (int i = 0; i < args.length; i++) {
046      if (args[i].equals("-server")) {
047        if(++i >= args.length) {
048          err.println("** Missing server name");
049          usage();
050        }
051
052        serverName = args[i];
053
054      } if (args[i].equals("-verbose")) {
055        debug = true;
056
057      } else if (fileName == null) {
058        fileName = args[i];
059
060      } else if (recipient == null) {
061        recipient = args[i];
062
063      } else {
064        // Part of the subject
065        if(subject == null) {
066          subject = new StringBuffer();
067        }
068
069        subject.append(args[i] + " ");
070      }
071    }
072
073    // Check to make sure everything is okay
074    if (fileName == null) {
075      err.println("** No file specified");
076      usage();
077    }
078
079    if (recipient == null) {
080      err.println("** No recipient specified");
081      usage();
082    }
083
084    if (subject == null) {
085      // Default subject
086      subject = new StringBuffer("A file for you");
087    }
088
089    // Obtain a Session for sending email
090    Properties props = new Properties();
091    props.put("mail.smtp.host", serverName);
092    Session session = Session.getDefaultInstance(props, null);
093    session.setDebug(debug);
094
095    MimeMessage message = new MimeMessage(session);
096
097    try {
098      InternetAddress[] to = {new InternetAddress(recipient)};
099      message.setRecipients(Message.RecipientType.TO, to);
100
101    } catch (AddressException ex) {
102      err.println("** Invalid address: " + recipient);
103      System.exit(1);
104
105    } catch (MessagingException ex) {
106      err.println("** MessagingException: " + ex);
107      System.exit(1);
108    }
109    
110    File file = new File(fileName);
111    if (!file.exists()) {
112      err.println("** File " + file + " does not exist!");
113      System.exit(1);
114    }
115
116    // This will be a multi-part MIME message
117    MimeBodyPart textPart = new MimeBodyPart();
118    try {
119      textPart.setContent("File " + file, "text/plain");
120
121    } catch (MessagingException ex) {
122      err.println("** Exception with text part: " + ex);
123      System.exit(1);
124    }
125
126    // Read in the file and make a MimeBodyPart out of it
127    DataSource ds = new FileDataSource(file);
128    DataHandler dh = new DataHandler(ds);
129    MimeBodyPart filePart = new MimeBodyPart();
130    try {
131      filePart.setDataHandler(dh);
132      filePart.setFileName(file.getName());
133      filePart.setDescription("The file you requested");
134
135    } catch (MessagingException ex) {
136      err.println("** Exception with file part: " + ex);
137      System.exit(1);
138    }
139
140    try {
141      Multipart mp = new MimeMultipart();
142      mp.addBodyPart(textPart);
143      mp.addBodyPart(filePart);
144
145      message.setContent(mp);
146
147      // Finally, send the message
148      Transport.send(message);
149
150    } catch (MessagingException ex) {
151      err.println("** Exception while adding parts and sending: " +
152                  ex);
153      System.exit(1);
154    }
155    
156  }
157  
158
159}
